title.value: Imaging of Neck Nodes in Head and Neck Cancers e a Comprehensive Update
title.justification: The title directly states the focus of the paper on neck node imaging in head and neck cancers and provides an update on the subject.
title.quote: Imaging of Neck Nodes in Head and Neck Cancers e a Comprehensive Update

extractions.description: This paper reviews the diagnosis and management of neck nodes in head and neck cancers, emphasizing sentinel node anatomy, pathogenesis, imaging techniques including radiogenomics and artificial intelligence, and image-guided interventions.

type.justification: The paper provides a comprehensive review and update on existing imaging methodologies and the role of AI, rather than conducting new empirical research.
type.quote: The aim of this review is to provide a comprehensive overview of the diagnosis and management of involved neck nodes with a focus on sentinel node anatomy, pathogenesis, imaging correlates (including radiogenomics and artificial intelligence) and the role of image-guided interventions.

name.justification: The paper is primarily focused on imaging techniques used for diagnosing and managing neck nodes in head and neck cancers.
name.quote: Lymph node imaging with various radiological modalities, including ultrasound, computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging, has been widely used.

name.justification: The paper explores the emerging role of artificial intelligence in improving neck node imaging.
name.quote: Finally, there is an emerging role for artificial intelligence in neck node imaging that has shown promising results.

name.justification: The paper mentions radiogenomics as a part of the imaging correlates being discussed for neck node imaging.
